content: I think, by your definition, everything (even Tolkien and Martin and Rothfuss and…) is worldconjuring. There are always details left to the reader. (Same with characterization.) I think the question for any reader is, am I in my “sweet spot” where I’m getting enough detail that the world is forming in my mind (and is plausible and wondrous and inviting) without so much detail that I’m being suffocated? Some readers want things written sparely — “I can do the rest, thank you” — while others want lush descriptions of landscape and clothes and culture that they can become fully immersed in. So when I read “against worldbuilding”, I see “don’t give me more detail than I like, and I don’t like much”.
